intro: Phlegmariurus dacrydioides, commonly known as the yellow-stemmed clubmoss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Lepidoziaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems that are typically yellowish-green in color. The plant forms dense, cushion-like growths and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are closely spaced and have a distinct, elongated shape. Phlegmariurus dacrydioides plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various small organisms.
